title: Windows 10 + PWAs: A Progress Report
description: I sat down with Paul Thurrott and a handful of my Edge colleagues to talk about PWAs and the new Edge.

title: 15+ Experts Share Their Web Performance Advice for 2018
description: Just like it says on the tin.

title: Ask a UXpert: How Do You Design for Headless Interfaces?
description: Oliver Lindberg interviewed a few of us to ask our thoughts on designing for aural experiences.

title: This is What Microsoft Said About PWAs at Build 2018
description: Paul recaps Build’s PWA content with lots of attributions to me.

title: Microsoft’s Bold Plan to Bring PWAs to Windows 10
description: Jeff Burtoft & I sat down with Paul Thurrott to talk abotu PWAs and Windows 10.

title: The Tools I Use
description: I chatted a bit with Eric Meyer about the tools I’m currently using every day.

title: How to make software decisions with everyone in mind
description: I sat down with Charlie Moss of Skuid to talk about user experience, accessibility, progressive enhancement, and moving peoples’ cheese.

title: How The Best Ecommerce Sites Win at Web Design
description: In a discussion about e-commerce, I talked a bit about the importance of the often overlooked checkout page.

title: The future of adaptive user interfaces
description: I answered a few questions about adaptive interfaces and my upcoming keynote at Generate Conf.

title: A Funny Thing Happened To Me On The Way To 2016…
description: I join an impressive list of AEA speakers in reflecting on where we were in our careers 10 years ago.

title: Gone fishin': Patagonia bids farewell to mobile app
description: Quoted again on Progressive Web Apps.

title: WTF are Progressive Web Apps?
description: Digiday’s coverage of Progressive Web Apps includes a bit of commentary from me.

title: Software developers keep outdated tech relevant thanks to Chattanooga's Open Device Lab
description: A bit about the CHA Open Device Lab which Kelly & I co-founded.

title: An Interview with Aaron Gustafson on Crafting Rich Experiences with Progressive Enhancement
description: Peachpit interviews me about progressive enhancement, the Second Edition of <cite>Adaptive Web Design</cite>, and what I love about Chattanooga.

title: Web Performance: 20+ Experts Share Their Advice and Mistakes
description: Mine not withstanding, there is some truly great advice in this post.

title: 60 Web Performance Experts to Follow Online
description: I’m honored to have been included on this list!

title: Chattanooga Chew
description: Eric Meyer asked me about my new digs at Microsoft, living in Chattanooga, and how I found my way onto the Web.

title: Microsoft Hires Two Open Standards Warriors (And Ex-Foes) For Its Developer Evangelism Unit
description: It’s strange to have a new job make the news.

title: 10 web design trends that will change everything in 2015
description: A distillation of the Net Magazine piece (below) into 10 picks.

title: Top 20 Web Design Trends for 2015
description: A handful of Web folks, myself included, were asked weigh in on what we think 2015 will bring. My bet: Isomorphic JavaScript.

title: QuickPanel: Voice
description: I joined Steve Portigal and Whitney Quesenbery to talk about voice interfaces.

title: Aaron Gustafson: The Interview
description: To say I was floored that the venerable <cite>Net Magazine</cite> asked if I’be be the subject of their Interview spread would be the understatement of the century. I mean holy crap! It was an honor to be asked and I loved getting to wax philosophical about progressive enhancement, web standards, and the future of web design.

title: 15 Pro Techniques for Beating Creative Block
description: Dan Rubin, Trent Walton, Derek Featherstone, Rachel Shillcock, and I discussed creative block and what we do to move past it.

title: Defining and Understanding Adaptive Content
description: Wherein I talk a bit about content strategy in the era of responsive design.

outlet: The Top 50 Books for Web Designers
description: My book made the top of the web designer’s Christmas reading list!

title: Responsive Web Design: 6 Experts, 4 Questions
description: Helen Bailey cornered Brad Frost, Tim Kadlec, Ben Callahan, Dan Mall, David Rupert, and me to get our thoughts on responsive design.

title: Big Question: What Was the Last Thing You Built for Fun?
description: I got to talk a little about my pet project, [tipr.mobi](http://tipr.mobi).

title: Big Question: What Skills Does a Digital Designer Need In 2013?
description: In a nutshell: I think it’s imprtant to be familiar with the technologies that drive the web, but I think it’s unrealistic to expect every designer to be able to code the websites they help shape.

title: Big Question: How Do You Handle Project Management?
description: I weigh in regarding the dust-up Andy Rutledge created with his tirade against project mamangers. Simply: Good project managers are a godsend.

title: Devs Respond to the Adobe Edge Suite
description: As part of a feature on Adobe’s release of its Edge Suite, I offered some of my thoughts.

title: Big Question: Should We Drop Social Media Buttons?
description: While I do think social media buttons are often overused with little to know thought, I don’t despise them and believe they can be used smartly.

title: Coding the Future: HTML5 Takes the Internet by Storm
description: The BBC was doing a story on the rise of HTML5 and asked if I would agree to be interviewed. Are you friggin’ kidding me?

title: Webkit Scuppers Skip-To-Content Links
description: I weigh in on Webkit’s issue with moving focus to targeted elements. Thankfully, the issue has been resolved now.

title: 15 Top Web Design and Development Trends For 2012
description: I call on responsive designers to consider smaller, “low-end” tablets and phones.

title: Firefox 6 out Today
description: I had a few things to say about Firefox’s move to a rapid release cycle.

title: Google Apps Ditches Support for IE7
description: I made a few comments about Google’s retirement of IE7.

title: Big Question: Fair Play
description: My thoughts on web conferences.
